workflow_rationale: This is a new feature that adds comprehensive analytics to the platform. It involves database schema additions, query functions, server actions, and a new admin dashboard page. The phases follow the data flow: database → queries → actions → UI.

phases.name: Database Views & Functions
phases.description: Create optimized database views and aggregate functions for analytics queries to ensure efficient data retrieval

subtasks.description: Create analytics database migration with views for all metrics

verification.command: psql $DATABASE_URL -c "SELECT * FROM analytics_user_growth LIMIT 1;" 2>/dev/null || echo 'Views need to be created'

subtasks.notes:
Created analytics database migration with views for all metrics including:
- analytics_user_growth: User registrations and cumulative counts
- analytics_job_completion: Job posting and completion metrics
- analytics_transaction_volume: Transaction volume and success rates
- analytics_geographic_distribution: Worker/job distribution by location
- analytics_trending_categories: Most in-demand job categories
- analytics_compliance_violations: KYC verification status tracking
- analytics_revenue: Platform revenue and earnings metrics
- analytics_booking_summary: Booking status and timeline metrics

Also created materialized views for DAU/MAU calculations and secure wrapper functions for admin-only access.

phases.name: TypeScript Types
phases.description: Create TypeScript type definitions for all analytics data structures

subtasks.notes:
Created comprehensive TypeScript type definitions for all analytics data structures in lib/types/analytics.ts following patterns from lib/types/payment.ts and lib/types/job.ts. Includes:

- Date range filter types with preset options
- User growth metrics (new registrations, cumulative counts, DAU/MAU)
- Job completion metrics (status breakdown, completion rates)
- Transaction volume metrics (success rates, amounts, fees)
- Geographic distribution (workers/jobs by location)
- Trending categories (demand ratios, budgets)
- Compliance violations (KYC verification tracking)
- Revenue metrics (gross/net revenue, platform fees)
- Booking summary (status breakdown, earnings)
- Export functionality types (CSV/PDF)

TypeScript verification passed with 0 errors.

phases.name: Database Query Functions
phases.description: Create Supabase query functions for fetching analytics data

subtasks.description: Create analytics query functions in lib/supabase/queries/analytics.ts
subtasks.notes:
Created analytics query functions in lib/supabase/queries/analytics.ts following patterns from lib/supabase/queries/wallets.ts. Includes:

- User growth metrics: getUserGrowthMetrics(), getDailyActiveUsers(), getMonthlyActiveUsers()
- Job completion metrics: getJobCompletionMetrics()
- Transaction volume metrics: getTransactionVolumeMetrics()
- Geographic distribution: getGeographicDistribution()
- Trending categories: getTrendingCategories()
- Compliance/KYC metrics: getComplianceMetrics()
- Revenue metrics: getRevenueMetrics()
- Booking metrics: getBookingMetrics()
- Aggregated dashboard: getAnalyticsDashboard() for parallel fetching of all metrics
- Materialized view refresh functions: refreshDailyActiveUsers(), refreshMonthlyActiveUsers()

All functions call secure RPC wrapper functions from the database with admin-only access control. Date range filtering supported for time-series metrics. TypeScript verification passed with 0 errors.

phases.name: Server Actions
phases.description: Create server actions for analytics data fetching with date filtering

subtasks.description: Create analytics server actions with date filtering
subtasks.notes:
Created comprehensive server actions for analytics data fetching with date filtering and admin access control in lib/actions/analytics.ts following patterns from lib/actions/payments.ts. Includes:

- Admin role verification function (verifyAdminAccess)
- Date range validation with multiple preset options (today, yesterday, last_7_days, last_30_days, last_90_days, this_month, last_month, this_year, custom)
- Individual metric fetchers:
  - getAnalyticsUserGrowth() - User growth metrics with date filtering
  - getAnalyticsDailyActiveUsers() - DAU metrics
  - getAnalyticsMonthlyActiveUsers() - MAU metrics
  - getAnalyticsJobCompletion() - Job completion metrics
  - getAnalyticsTransactionVolume() - Transaction volume metrics
  - getAnalyticsGeographicDistribution() - Worker/job distribution by location
  - getAnalyticsTrendingCategories() - Most in-demand categories
  - getAnalyticsCompliance() - KYC verification tracking
  - getAnalyticsRevenue() - Platform revenue metrics
  - getAnalyticsBookings() - Booking status and metrics
- Aggregated dashboard action (getAnalyticsDashboard) for efficient parallel fetching
- Materialized view refresh actions:
  - refreshAnalyticsDailyActiveUsers()
  - refreshAnalyticsMonthlyActiveUsers()
  - refreshAllAnalytics() - Refreshes all views

All actions return consistent result objects with success boolean, error messages (in Indonesian), and data. TypeScript verification passed with 0 errors from our code.

phases.name: Admin Dashboard UI
phases.description: Create the admin analytics dashboard page with all metrics

subtasks.description: Add admin analytics navigation to navigation-config.ts
subtasks.notes:
Added admin analytics navigation to navigation-config.ts:
- Imported BarChart icon from lucide-react
- Created adminNavItems array with analytics navigation item
- Navigation entry points to /admin/analytics with 'Analitik Platform' label
- Follows existing pattern from workerNavItems and businessNavItems

subtasks.description: Create admin analytics dashboard page at app/(dashboard)/admin/analytics/page.tsx

phases.name: Export Functionality
phases.description: Add CSV and PDF export functionality for analytics reports

subtasks.description: Create export utility functions and add export buttons to dashboard

phases.name: Integration & Testing
phases.description: End-to-end verification of all analytics features

steps: Verify all 7 metric cards load (user growth, job completion, transactions, geographic, categories, compliance, revenue)
Verify date range filter works and updates all metrics
Verify CSV export works for each metric
Verify PDF export generates complete report

parallel_groups.reason: Type definitions are independent of database implementation

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Sequential execution recommended due to data flow dependencies

acceptance_criteria: Date range filtering works for all metrics
CSV export works for all metrics
Only admin role users can access analytics
verification_strategy.reasoning: Medium risk change adds new admin functionality but doesn't modify existing features. Manual verification of data accuracy and UI functionality is required.
